summary: Mount Rainier is a massive, active volcano in Washington state, USA. Standing at 14,411 feet, it's the tallest mountain in the Cascade Range. It's also known for its many glaciers. Due to its closeness to Seattle and the potential for an eruption, it's considered one of the world's most dangerous volcanoes. Despite the risks, many people climb it; over 400,000 between 1950 and 2018. Unfortunately, climbing this mountain has led to several deaths.
title: Mount Rainier
